text:
10.8.25- Added disclaimer about what I've seen of CK's debates. May CK rest in peace. 

10.2.25-
I just uploaded 2 videos on "The Big Picture of the Bible" very helpful for new or seasoned followers of our Messiah, Jesus Christ, the olive-skinned , Middle-eastern looking, brown-haired, brown-eyed (odds are), Jewish carpenter from Nazareth, whose sandals we are unworthy to unstrap.

Nuance added 10.4.25:
I'm trying to "meet people where they are" in their temporarily spiritually immature thinking, often young people of various skin tones, precious souls who God loves, who hopefully won't stay concerned about Jesus' physical appearance. In my ancient 49-year-old opinion, Jesus' physical appearance does not matter, His mission does, and none of us were there, but based on who He was, a Jewish carpenter, God in the flesh, we can make guesses and rule out, I believe, with a HIGH degree of certainty, the silly Renaissance notion of Jesus being pale, with blond hair and blue eyes. Isaiah even seems to rule out the idea of Jesus being handsome - "having no form or majesty that we should desire him".

Onward...

9.17.25- I welcome the wolves to this chat. God (or perhaps just the algorithm) seems to be using your hatred of Charlie and God and all that is decent and good in the world like it's electricity to this one of millions of temporary digital microphones Charlie bought with his blood, that flawed Christ followers are speaking from, on a channel of a nobody, and God seems to be using the view count increase and subscribers (truth seekers) increase, and likes increase, and shares increase, and comments increase, like they are wattage to this temporary digital speaker. To God be the glory. The spreading light consumes the dark. Jesus is Lord. Jesus is the good shepherd. Not Charlie Kirk. And if Charlie was alive and saw me, who has never met him, type the above words, he might type: "amen" (just my opinion)
-dmh 9.17.25

"Aslan is on the move. He is not a tame lion" - paraphrased from separate sections of C.S. Lewis's "The Lion, The Witch, and the Wardrobe"


   James 1:19 ‚Äî ‚Äúquick to hear, slow to speak, slow to anger.‚Äù 

I‚Äôm praying for Charlie‚Äôs wife, kids, and everyone shaken by this.


May God have mercy on us.
..........
Back in the early days of the church, they would stone you for standing up for your beliefs.
Now, you can get shot.

.......

When the first martyr Stephen was stoned in Acts 7, he cried out:
"Lord, do not hold this sin against them.‚Äù (Acts 7:60, ESV)

I didn‚Äôt know Charlie Kirk personally ‚Äî but based on what I‚Äôve seen,
he grew in his faith during his public life and became quite respectful toward many (if not most?) of those who disagreed with him.

I want to believe, if he had the chance, he would have said the same thing Stephen did:

Acts 7:59‚Äì60 (ESV):
59. And as they were stoning Stephen, he called out, ‚ÄúLord Jesus, receive my spirit.‚Äù
60. And falling to his knees he cried out with a loud voice, ‚ÄúLord, do not hold this sin against them.‚Äù And when he had said this, he fell asleep.

That‚Äôs the kind of man I want to believe Charlie was,
based on videos I‚Äôve seen of how kindly he treated many of his *opponents.

*Disclaimer added 10.8.25-
To date I've only seen approximately (wild guess)- 0.001% of the 10 or so years (?) of TPUSA video footage of CK, and mainly just clips, but I did see the whole non-TPUSA Club Random Bill Maher & Charlie Kirk podcast (on Charlie Kirk's channel) where Charlie commented on how it went, and I saw several minutes of the Jubilee debate video- Chalie Kirk vs. College Students).... but based on the limited footage I've seen of Charlie‚Äôs "Christian apologetics era" (for lack of a better word), inspired by Frank Turek and Ray Comfort ... I'll say:
.......

Charlie wasn‚Äôt perfect. He misspoke at times ‚Äî as we humans tend to do.
He said controversial things ‚Äî but controversial things are often true.

Example:

 The resurrection of my Lord and Savior Jesus Christ
= highly controversial AND true at the same time.



Charlie‚Äôs is the kind of courage and grace we need more of, in my opinion.
‚Äì dmh

.......

In this episode of Club Random, Charlie Kirk joins Bill Maher
for a wide-ranging conversation that aired on April 20, 2025.

At one point, Charlie and Bill briefly discuss the need for personal security ‚Äî
a passing moment that now feels sobering in retrospect.

4 months and 21 days later, Charlie was shot and killed.

.......

Reports as of Sep 12 say the bullet casings at the scene were engraved with:

‚ÄúHey, fascist! CATCH!‚Äù

Lyrics from the anti-fascist song ‚ÄúBella Ciao‚Äù

‚ÄúIf you read this, you are gay LMAO‚Äù

‚ÄúNotices bulge, OWO what‚Äôs this?‚Äù


.......

Whether you agreed with Charlie or not,
this wasn‚Äôt just about politics ‚Äî
it was about the cost of standing up for your beliefs
in an increasingly volatile culture.

.......

üôè Pray for God's will to be done with justice for Charlie Kirk's family.

üïäÔ∏è May Charlie rest in peace.

üõê May God comfort and protect his wife and kids.

God is a God of mercy,
but also a God of justice.

Don‚Äôt take freedom of speech for granted (preaching to myself)

Jesus is Lord.

üïäÔ∏è Be excellent to each other.

.......

An atheist-turned-preacher once said:

1. God loves you


2. God wants you


3. God made a way for you and me ‚Äî & even murderers ‚Äî to be with Him:
(The cross. Jesus is the way.)


4. The devil will do everything he can to keep you from believing the first 3.

.......

üôè Want to Know How to Be Saved?

üìñ The Bible teaches a simple but powerful pattern:


---

1. Hear the Gospel

> ‚ÄúSo faith comes from hearing, and hearing through the word of Christ.‚Äù
‚Äî Romans 10:17 (ESV)




---

2. Believe in Jesus Christ

> ‚ÄúFor God so loved the world, that he gave his only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish but have eternal life.‚Äù
‚Äî John 3:16 (ESV)



> ‚ÄúWhoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.‚Äù
‚Äî Mark 16:16 (ESV)




---

3. Repent of Your Sins

> ‚ÄúThe times of ignorance God overlooked, but now he commands all people everywhere to repent.‚Äù
‚Äî Acts 17:30 (ESV)



> ‚ÄúRepent therefore, and turn again, that your sins may be blotted out.‚Äù
‚Äî Acts 3:19 (ESV)



> ‚ÄúRepent and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.‚Äù
‚Äî Acts 2:38 (ESV)




---

4. Confess Jesus as Lord

> ‚ÄúBecause, if you confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.‚Äù
‚Äî Romans 10:9 (ESV)



> ‚ÄúFor with the heart one believes and is justified, and with the mouth one confesses and is saved.‚Äù
‚Äî Romans 10:10 (ESV)



> ‚ÄúEveryone who acknowledges me before men, I also will acknowledge before my Father who is in heaven.‚Äù
‚Äî Matthew 10:32 (ESV)




---

5. Be Baptized Into Christ

> ‚ÄúAnd now why do you wait? Rise and be baptized and wash away your sins, calling on his name.‚Äù
‚Äî Acts 22:16 (ESV)



> ‚ÄúBaptism, which corresponds to this, now saves you‚Äînot as a removal of dirt from the body but as an appeal to God for a good conscience, through the resurrection of Jesus Christ.‚Äù
‚Äî 1 Peter 3:21 (ESV)



> ‚ÄúWe were buried therefore with him by baptism into death, in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead by the glory of the Father, we too might walk in newness of life.‚Äù
‚Äî Romans 6:4 (ESV)




---

6. Live a Faithful Life

> ‚ÄúBe faithful unto death, and I will give you the crown of life.‚Äù
‚Äî Revelation 2:10 (ESV)



> ‚Äú...not neglecting to meet together, as is the habit of some, but encouraging one another‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚Äî Hebrews 10:25 (ESV)



> ‚ÄúBut if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.‚Äù
‚Äî 1 John 1:7 (ESV)




---

‚úùÔ∏è Summary:

Hear

Believe

Repent

Confess

Be Baptized

Remain Faithful


.......

> ‚ÄúWhoever believes and is baptized will be saved‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚Äî Mark 16:16



> ‚ÄúRepent and be baptized‚Ä¶ for the forgiveness of your sins‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚Äî Acts 2:38



> ‚ÄúBaptism now saves you‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚Äî 1 Peter 3:21



> ‚ÄúBe faithful unto death‚Ä¶‚Äù
‚Äî Revelation 2:10



.......

Jesus is Lord. Obey the Gospel. Call on His Name. Walk in the Light.

‚Äì dmh
Draft 1, 9.11.25
Draft 2, 9.12.25
Updated at top 9.13.25, 9.17.25

text:
10.10.25- How to respond to liars and slanderers who you hope will repent and trust Christ for salvation someday.

 A person made in the image of God with the handle @marc2789 said:

> ‚ÄúKirk was a Nazi-fascist, and those who supported him ignored the fact that they were supporting someone who, if he had lived in the 1930s, would have supported Mussolini or Hitler!‚Äù

...............

Here is one response:

@marc2789
Hi marc,
Would you like to dialogue, or just call people you've never met names like "Nazi-fascist" when you can't prove them wrong?


 The phrase ‚ÄúNazi-fascist‚Äù gets thrown around so casually now that it loses all meaning. 

Charlie Kirk was not perfect. 

Neither am I.

 Neither are you. 

But comparing him to Hitler ‚Äî a man responsible for the slaughter of 6 million Jews and tens of millions of others ‚Äî is not just historically irresponsible...

..... it‚Äôs literally DEADLY SLANDER... the kind of lies that lead to Tyler Robinson justifying murdering a husband and father.

Charlie spoke out against authoritarianism, censorship, and against the breakdown of the family.

He advocated for the unborn (pro-life), for the Constitution, for free speech, and for biblical values. 

Disagree with his politics if you want.

 That‚Äôs your right.

But equating that to Nazism? 

That‚Äôs a reckless lie ‚Äî

....  and lies like that poison the national discourse, justify violence, and...

..... dehumanize people who think differently than you.....

Charlie Kirk was a human being ‚Äî made in the image of God. 


And no one should be gunned down in America or anywhere else over political disagreement.

Let‚Äôs all try to remember:

‚ÄúDo not bear false witness against your neighbor.‚Äù
(Exodus 20:16)

Marc:
Do you believe Jesus Christ rose from the dead?

The answer to that question is the foundation of one's whole worldview.
author: @David.Michael.Harvey

text:
@David - My Bro in Christ, I have been thinking the same way.

Lord Jesus on the cross - Father, forgive them for they don't know what they do 

Stephen - Lord Jesus, don't hold this sin against them.

They were able to say it since they were both obedient to the guidance of the Holy Spirit. 

Very few people live by the Holy Spirit. You are one I think. Charlie would have forgiven based on all the things about Christ I found he spoke about.
author: @MrWonderful-b2q

text: @mrwonderful.. That's the best we can do. Amen brother. The best attitude us flawed Christ followers can have. It's unnatural to say what Jesus did. It's supernatural: "Father forgive the people crucifying me, for they know not what they do". And Stephen being stoned. Can you imagine? Stones? Slowly being killed in a pit for proclaiming Christ as the Messiah? The fulfiller of Isaiah 53 and so many other prophesies. The 30 pieces of silver were even prophesied! The beauty of it:  the devil didn't see God's plan coming!  I can not, personally, be that forgiving (like Jesus and Stephen) of people hating me and wanting me dead, but I can with God's help. Without God's help I'm just as vindictive as the next guy. Us humans cannot save ourselves. Thank you for your comment, brother.
author: @David.Michael.Harvey
